> Aero testing/tweaking

> Texturing

> Creation of a user guide mor the mod

What is going on Mike ? I am still wishing you the best of luck with this MOD. 

I tried your shuttle and it flies really well. There are just some issues like a little bit of a mess with files here and there and those RCS working and not working sometimes, but the glide aspect of the shuttle is really superb.

No? Hope I dodnt make it oneshot animation
i think u did that

and the tail to the multipart shuttle is too small

just a question, i saw this mod a few days back, so i installed version 1.1.31 (im on ksp 1.0.2) and it only came up with a few parts on the game, why did it not come up with all of the parts and what happened!?![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Give us at least your latest versions you have on your PC, as open source. Maybe somebody can do something with it.

> 
> Give us at least your latest versions you have on your PC, as open source. Maybe somebody can do something with it.

If someone wants it continued then they must start off from dragons 0.9 release.

Thanks for your time and work Mike, hope you release your latest version, so someone could continue. You have been one of the reasons I came back to KSP, I thank you for that but it's ok. I know how difficult is to mantain such a product (I was an active modder for Flight Simulator 2004, and a tester for some premium modding houses like Carenado). We all have a life outside this forum and game, but you really made me enjoy both my 'life' in KSP and my real life, giving me hours of entertaiment. Thanks and godspeed for your future plans

I was actually interested in getting this mod yesterday... but now its gone ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif);.;![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif). The only mod left now is the ISS mod. I hope I can find a space shuttle mod as good as this one. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif);.;

Dudefinal. When i get home, i'll see,about getting my version to you. Don't know how,up,to,date it is, but, it's there if you want it.
Does anybody have a copy of his latest release? if so, it might be possible to reconstruct the entire release from that.

I have a somewhat latest, but i'll see,if,i can't talk mike into giving me the latest he had and continue it from there, with a team (yeah, i can't model or any other rancy stuff, but i,want to keep,this thing alive. I'll see,if,i,can get xan on board to assist in cfg stuff. Anyone into texturing and modeling?)
I could help out with modelling, and texturing too, though I haven't modelled shuttle parts before. Would be a nice challenge though.

> 
> Dudefinal. When i get home, i'll see,about getting my version to you. Don't know how,up,to,date it is, but, it's there if you want it.

Yeah I'll take it cant be too out of date. I really want a nice looking Space Shuttle in KSP.

EDIT: Man I shouldve downloaded it yesterday ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif).
Ok, i think i,got my gf on board. I have decided that xannari ferrows, myself, and anyone else who wishes to,join, will create a new page and continue the project.
I can hop along, won't be of much help until I can learn to model though

I'll set up the new thread when i get home,from school! Kart and jeast? Thank you for supporting my idea to continue this project. Mike? I hope you eventually return and think about asisting us. And, if you plan to leave the iss stuff as well, i'll add that to the project. Sure thing, spock! Take all the time you need. I won't be able to start the new thread until i get home from school. Jeast or someone, go onto mike's github and grab his latest before he has a chance to remove it, please.

The only way to get people to help is to leave... please see the readme on my github page for copyrights regarding the parts I created.

[https://github.com/MrMikeNZ/Space-Shuttle/blob/master/README.md](https://github.com/MrMikeNZ/Space-Shuttle/blob/master/README.md)

> The only way to get people to help is to leave... please see the readme on my github page for copyrights regarding the parts I created.
> [https://github.com/MrMikeNZ/Space-Shuttle/blob/master/README.md](https://github.com/MrMikeNZ/Space-Shuttle/blob/master/README.md)

Come on Mike don't be angry my man, lets all call it a day and reconsider tomorrow.

BTW it won't be enough that you changed the license 3 minutes ago. I have your last release on my pc and the license in that one is this one: [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/)

so if you really want to stop this please just talk.

Come on lets all stop this madness, sleep a night over it and talk as adults tomorrow.

So people decide they love a mod so much that they want to keep it going, then the creator specifically changes his readme to not let them do that? That's just wrong. Wrong, man. And, yes, you can see what changes you made.

So do we have permission to edit your parts (me, Jeast, Sampa)? 

Well, I'd have helped you earlier, but I just felt too slow in comparison with you, I wouldn't been able to keep up with you. And you seemed to manage everything alone just fine.
